result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacorrey Omar Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: AS TO ALL COUNTS: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact and only if the injunction has been changed.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 7/24/15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacorrey Omar Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court modified the no contact order to a no violent contact order.

Defendant Jacorrey Omar Johnson in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1 AND TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 17 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 17 days time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 7/24/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact and only if the injunction has been changed.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Jacorrey Omar Johnson in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 973.055(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Jacorrey Omar Johnson in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing.   Case is adjourned to Branch 40.   Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. tk

15RM007355  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-11-2015
Court sets bail at $300.00 cash. Court advises defendant the No Contact Order remains in effect.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Cash bail $300.00.

BRANCH 23 for BRANCH 40.
Defendant Jacorrey Omar Johnson in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Jacorrey Omar Johnson in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Charles Leach.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court is in trial.  Branch 23 agreed to take this case for preliminary hearing.  Matter sent to Branch 23 forthwith.  rmm

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacorrey Omar Johnson
Current: 3144 N 28TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 02-01-2015)
Prior: 9109 West Carmen Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MONIQUE B., J.O.J. (11/18/09) AND Z.K.D. (9/29/04).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jacorrey Omar Johnson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Jacorrey Omar Johnson in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  ENTRY OF PLEA TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS WITHHELD.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
